result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Manuel Perez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose Manuel Perez in court.  
Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Jose Manuel Perez.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Room 400 Courthouse.
Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose Manuel Perez in court.  
Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Jose Manuel Perez.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a resolution date. 
Defense  advised to file  plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jose Manuel Perez in court with Attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge Cimpl. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and sent to defense counsel.

Defendant Jose Manuel Perez in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Joel Mogren, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to preliminary court. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Indigency hearing originally scheduled for July 15th, 2022 in Branch 45. Court down. Hearing rescheduled for July 25th, 2022 in Branch 45. Parties notified.

Defendant notified by phone. Advised of new court and of notice being mailed.
Indigency hearing on July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Advance Auto Parts
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Jose Manuel Perez in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Jose Manuel Perez in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jose Manuel Perez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jose Manuel Perez
Current: 2487 S 15th St, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 07-12-2022)
Prior: 5634 West Oklahoma Avenue #103, Milwaukee, WI 53219
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jose Manuel Perez not in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/27/2022@02:00pm
